page.title: 07Farming:Livestock.
page.content: The most common breed of cow for milk is Friesian.Milk goes to Express Dairy at Appleby for cheese and butter,Dairy Crest at Aspatria for cheese and M.M.B at Carlisle for bottling.A good yield is 25/30 litres. Calves are produced, preferably in spring,from 2 year old cows.Farmers use their own bull,have use of a bull,or use the A.I.Centre. Calves can be sold at 1 year old or kept for beef then sent at 2/3years to the abattoir at Penrith.Cattle market: Carlisle.Feed:-home produced cereals- Mill produced cow cake. Sheep breeds: Swaledale for the fells. Grey-face for lower land.Fell sheep are brought down for supplementary winter feed and lamb ing.Other sheep are fed through winter with crushed barley. Shearing takes place in June.Wool is sent to Hexham & sorted.Lazonby is the best known sheep market.Sheep dogs give valuable help.
